parts.text:
**Document Type:**
Handwritten Notes

**Summary:**
The document contains handwritten notes on various machine learning and optimization problems, including maximum likelihood estimation, constrained optimization with equality and inequality constraints, matrix constrained optimization, and dual optimization problems.

**Key Information & Localization:**
* Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE) for Gamma Distribution
    * Location: Page 1, top-left
    * Confidence: High
* Formula for Gamma Distribution
    * Location: Page 1, top-left
    * Confidence: High
* Likelihood Function L(b)
    * Location: Page 1, middle
    * Confidence: High
* MLE Estimate:  b̂ = a/x̄
    * Location: Page 1, bottom
    * Confidence: High
* Problem 2: Solve with equality constraint
    * Location: Page 2, top
    * Confidence: High
* Lagrange Function L(μ)
    * Location: Page 2, middle
    * Confidence: High
* Dual Function D(μ)
    * Location: Page 2, middle
    * Confidence: High
* Final Answer for xᵢ: xᵢ =  n/Σe^(cᵢ/n)
    * Location: Page 2, bottom
    * Confidence: High
* Problem 3: Solve with inequality constraint
    * Location: Page 3, top
    * Confidence: High
* Lagrange Function L(μ, λ)
    * Location: Page 3, middle
    * Confidence: High
* Final Answer for x_opt: x_opt = b/a^T
    * Location: Page 3, bottom
    * Confidence: High
* Problem 4: Matrix constrained optimization
    * Location: Page 4, top
    * Confidence: High
* Lagrange Function L(μ, λ)
    * Location: Page 4, middle
    * Confidence: High
* Final Answer for x_opt: x_opt = b/tr(A^(1/2))
    * Location: Page 4, bottom
    * Confidence: High
* Problem 5: Construct dual optimization problem
    * Location: Page 5, top
    * Confidence: High
* Lagrange Function L(x, μ)
    * Location: Page 5, middle
    * Confidence: High
* Dual optimization problem: L(μ) = -a^Ta/(1+μ)
    * Location: Page 5, bottom
    * Confidence: High

**Category:**
Assignment Submission

**Document Type:**
Handwritten Notes

**Summary:**
These are handwritten notes on decision trees and learning probabilities, covering concepts like piecewise constant prediction, overfitting, and the use of quadratic loss. The notes include mathematical formulas and examples to illustrate the concepts.

**Key Information & Localization:**
* Decision tree for simple predicates
    * Location: Top of the page, highlighted in green
    * Confidence: High
* DT builds precise piecewise constant prediction in feature space
    * Location: Below the title, first line
    * Confidence: High
* With enough splitting steps DT is able to overfit to arbitary dataset
    * Location: Below the first line
    * Confidence: High
* Class: 0, Class = x
    * Location: Left side of the page, near a diagram
    * Confidence: High
* threshold
    * Location: Middle of the page, near a diagram
    * Confidence: High
* Class=0-circle
    * Location: Middle of the page, near a diagram
    * Confidence: High
* Another example
    * Location: Right side of the page, near a diagram
    * Confidence: High
* to the split (threshold)
    * Location: Right side of the page, near a diagram
    * Confidence: High
* Learning probabilities
    * Location: Middle of the page, highlighted in pink
    * Confidence: High
* General idea: b(xi) correctly estimates probabilities if for all objects with positive class probability p their real positives class frequency is also p
    * Location: Below the "Learning probabilities" title
    * Confidence: High
* Consider all training objects are the same: x1 = x2 = ... xn
    * Location: Below the "General idea"
    * Confidence: High
* b(x1) = b(x2) = ... = b(xn) = b = const prediction
    * Location: Below the "Consider all training objects are the same"
    * Confidence: High
* arg min 1/N Σ L(yi,b) = 1/N Σ [yi=+1]
    * Location: Middle of the page, mathematical formula
    * Confidence: High
* N -> +∞ arg min E P(y|x) L(y,b) = P(y = +1|x)
    * Location: Middle of the page, mathematical formula
    * Confidence: High
* Example: quadratic loss
    * Location: Middle of the page, highlighted in yellow
    * Confidence: High
* L(y,b) = (b-[y=+1])²
    * Location: Below the "Example: quadratic loss"
    * Confidence: High
* Desired property: arg min be[0,1] Ep(y|x)L(y,b) = P(y = +1|x)
    * Location: Middle of the page, mathematical formula
    * Confidence: High
* Ep(y|x) L(y,b) = P(y = +1|x) (b-1)² + P(y = -1|x) (b-0)²
    * Location: Below the "Desired property"
    * Confidence: High
* = p(b-1)² + (1-p)b² -> min be[0,1]
    * Location: Below the previous line
    * Confidence: High
* d/db = 2p(b-1) + 2(1-p)b = -2p + 2b = 0 -> b_opt = p
    * Location: Bottom of the page, mathematical formula
    * Confidence: High
* Result: quadratic loss correctly estimates probabilities
    * Location: Bottom of the page
    * Confidence: High

**Category:**
Lecture Notes

**Document Type:**
PDF Page Image

**Summary:**
This document is a page from a novel, describing a tense encounter between two characters, Dr. Lanyon and a visitor, likely related to a medical or scientific experiment. The visitor's strange behavior and request for specific items suggest a mysterious and potentially dangerous situation.

**Key Information & Localization:**
* "Come, sir,” said I."
    * Location: Paragraph 1
    * Confidence: High
* "I beg your pardon, Dr. Lanyon," he replied civilly enough."
    * Location: Paragraph 3
    * Confidence: High
* "I come here at the instance of your colleague, Dr. Henry Jekyll, on a piece of business of some moment..."
    * Location: Paragraph 3
    * Confidence: High
* "There it is, sir," said I, pointing to the drawer, where it lay on the floor behind a table and still covered with the sheet."
    * Location: Paragraph 5
    * Confidence: High
* "Compose yourself," said I."
    * Location: Paragraph 7
    * Confidence: High
* "Have you a graduated glass?" he asked."
    * Location: Paragraph 8
    * Confidence: High

**Category:**
Other

**Document Type:**
Bar Chart

**Summary:**
The bar chart compares the average time per image (in milliseconds) for different Gemini model configurations across various regions.

**Key Information & Localization:**
* Title: Gemini Model Speed Comparison
    * Location: Top center
    * Confidence: High
* Y-axis label: Average Time per Image (ms)
    * Location: Left side
    * Confidence: High
* X-axis label: Model @ Region
    * Location: Bottom center
    * Confidence: High
* gemini-2.0-flash-lite-001 @ europe-west4: 1670 ms
    * Location: First bar, left
    * Confidence: High
* gemini-2.0-flash-001 @ europe-west4: 1829 ms
    * Location: Second bar
    * Confidence: High
* gemini-2.0-flash-001 @ europe-west1: 1868 ms
    * Location: Third bar
    * Confidence: High
* gemini-2.0-flash-lite-001 @ europe-west1: 1915 ms

    * Confidence: High

    * Confidence: High
* gemini-2.0-flash-001 @ us-central1: 4495 ms

    * Confidence: High

**Category:**
